intro: Arequipiopsis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers, which are typically blue or violet in color. The plants are perennial herbs with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Arequipiopsis species are often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. They play an important role in the local ecosystems and are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value.
